author: @NECN
title: Merck says experimental RSV treatment protected infants in trial, paving way for potential approval
text:
Merck said its experimental treatment designed to protect infants from respiratory syncytial virus showed positive results in a mid- to late-stage trial. The pharmaceutical giant could emerge as a new competitor in the market for treatments against RSV, which causes hundreds of infant deaths each year. Merck is discussing the study data with regulators worldwide, with a goal of making the treatment available for infants as early as the 2025 to 2026 RSV season. Merck on Thursday said its experimental treatment designed to protect infants from respiratory syncytial virus showed positive results in a mid- to late-stage trial, bringing the company one step closer to filing for approval of the shot.
The pharmaceutical giant could emerge as a new competitor in the market for treatments against RSV, which causes thousands of deaths among older Americans and hundreds of deaths among infants each year. Complications from the virus are the leading cause of hospitalization among newborns, making Merck’s drug a valuable new treatment option if approved.
Merck plans to discuss the study data with regulators worldwide, with a goal of making the treatment available for infants as early as the 2025 to 2026 RSV season, according to a release.
The trial examined the safety and efficacy of a single dose of the treatment, clesrovimab, in healthy preterm and full-term infants entering their first RSV season. Merck presented the results at the medical conference IDWeek in Los Angeles.
The treatment reduced RSV-related hospitalizations by more than 84% and decreased hospitalizations due to lower respiratory infections by 90% compared with a placebo among infants through five months, according to Merck. Clesrovimab also reduced lower respiratory infections that required medical attention by more than 60% compared with a placebo through five months.
RSV is a common cause of lower respiratory tract infections such as pneumonia. Results were consistent through both the five-month and six-month time points in the trial, Merck said.
The rates of adverse and serious side effects were comparable between patients who received Merck’s shot and those who took placebos in the trial. There were no treatment or RSV-related deaths in the study, the company added.
“These promising results demonstrating decreased incidence of RSV disease, including hospitalizations, highlight the potential for clesrovimab to play an important role in helping to alleviate the continued burden of RSV on infants and their families,” Dr. Octavio Ramilo, chair of the Department of Infectious Diseases at St. Jude’s Children’s Research Hospital, said in Merck’s release. Ramilo is also an investigator working on the trials.
Merck’s clesrovimab could potentially compete against a similar treatment from Sanofi and AstraZeneca called Beyfortus, which was in short supply nationwide last RSV season due to unprecedented demand. Both are monoclonal antibodies, which deliver antibodies directly into the bloodstream to provide immediate protection.
But Merck’s treatment can be administered to infants regardless of their weight, which the company said may offer convenience in terms of dosing. Meanwhile, the recommended dosage of Beyfortus is based on an infant’s body weight.
Last year, Pfizer and GSK rolled out RSV vaccines that are administered to expectant mothers who can pass on protection to their fetuses.

author: James Powel
title: Cytokinetics trial for hypertrophic cardiomyopathy could go to FDA
text: Treatment emerges for rare, symptomless heart condition in Cytokinetics drug trial [James Powel](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12244761002/james-powel/) A new drug to treat a rare heart condition may be set to go before the Food and Drug Administration. Pharmaceutical company Cytokinetics [announced Wednesday](https://ir.cytokinetics.com/news-releases/news-release-details/cytokinetics-announces-positive-results-sequoia-hcm-pivotal) that its drug aficamten produced, "statistically significant and clinically meaningful" results in the phase three trial of the [drug](/story/news/2023/12/25/weight-loss-abortion-drug-prices-psychedelics-hot-topics-of-2024/72027935007/). Aficamten is intended to treat hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, a condition that thickens the heart muscle and is present in .2% of the world's population, [according to the National Institute of Health](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK430788/). The company said in its press release that full results of the study would be presented at, "an upcoming medical conference." If the drug does make it to market it would compete against Bristol Meyer's drug Camzyos. "A therapy like aficamten that improves exercise capacity in a clinically meaningful manner, absent low (left ventricular ejection fraction) events that interrupt treatment, should be a welcome addition for HCM patients as well as the clinicians who treat them," Martin Maron, M.D., Director of the Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy Center at Lahey Hospital and Medical Center in Burlington, Massachusetts and principal investigator for the trial said. Cytokinetics stock closed down a quarter of a percent at [$83.24 per share](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/CYTK) Thursday but is still up significantly from [Tuesday's close of $45.71](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/CYTK/history?p=CYTK). What did the phase three trial find? Patients in the trial arm saw improvement in exercise tolerance, peak oxygen uptake and "clinically meaningful improvements" in the study's secondary endpoints including participant's Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire Clinical Summary Score, according to the release. The Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire Clinical Summary Score is a test that measures, "symptoms, physical and social limitations, and quality of life in patients with heart failure," [according to the Journal of American College of Cardiology](https://www.jacc.org/doi/10.1016/j.jacc.2020.09.542). Serious adverse effects occurred in 5.6% of people in the trial arm and 9.3% of people in the placebo arm. What is hypertrophic cardiomyopathy? Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy is a condition that causes the heart muscle to thicken and makes it more difficult to pump blood, [according to the Mayo Clinic](https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/hypertrophic-cardiomyopathy/symptoms-causes/syc-20350198). The condition is usually caused by genetics and does not cause symptoms in many cases. Symptoms, if they are experienced, can include: - Chest pain - Fainting - Heart murmur - Sensation of fast, fluttering or pounding heartbeats (palpitations) - Shortness of breath The Mayo Clinic recommends seeking immediate medical attention if a person is experiencing rapid or irregular heartbeat, difficulty breathing or chest pain. Loyola Marymount basketball star [Hank Gathers](https://www.aafp.org/pubs/afp/issues/2017/1201/p738.html) was killed by a cardiac arrest during a game in 1990 and his autopsy found that he had hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. Oklahoma City Thunder [draft pick](https://www.nba.com/thunder/news/release-johnson-230707) and former Florida Gator and Kansas State Wildcat star Keyonte Johnson was [diagnosed with the condition](https://okcthunderwire.usatoday.com/2023/06/23/okc-thunder-voices-zero-concerns-over-keyontae-johnsons-heart-condition/) after collapsing in a game in 2020.

author: Roger García
title: SMN pronostica lluvias puntuales fuertes en Chiapas y muy fuertes en Oaxaca, Veracruz y Tabasco
text:
El Servicio Meteorológico Nacional ( SMN ) informó que para este viernes 1 de noviembre el frente No. 6 se extenderá como estacionario sobre el sur de Estados Unidos y dejará de afectar al país. A su vez, una línea seca se establecerá entre Chihuahua y Coahuila, interaccionará con la entrada de aire cálido y húmedo del Golfo de México, ocasionando lluvias fuertes, posible caída de granizo y vientos fuertes con posible formación de torbellinos en Coahuila, Nuevo León y Tamaulipas.
#Pronóstico Meteorológico General de las 06:00 horas. Consúltalo en: https://t.co/R8Yan9wj3l pic.twitter.com/UHEQtZrTVA
— CONAGUA Clima (@conagua_clima) November 1, 2024
La onda tropical No. 30 se desplazará al sur de Guerrero y Michoacán, aportará humedad incrementando la probabilidad de lluvias puntuales fuertes en Guerrero, así como lluvias y chubascos en el occidente y centro del territorio nacional.
Un canal de baja presi ó n se extenderá sobre el oriente y sureste del país, en combinación con inestabilidad en altura , producirá lluvias fuertes a puntuales muy fuertes en ambas regiones, incluida la península de Yucatán, con lluvias puntuales intensas en Chiapas.
Finalmente, persistirá el ambiente vespertino caluroso a muy caluroso en las costas del Pacífico central y sur mexicano, con temperaturas máximas de 35 a 40 °C en Sinaloa, Nayarit, Jalisco, Colima y Michoacán.
Este es el pronóstico de lluvias para este viernes:
Muy fuertes con puntuales intensas (75 a 150 mm): Chiapas. Fuertes con puntuales muy fuertes (50 a 75 mm): Oaxaca, Veracruz y Tabasco. Intervalos de chubascos con lluvias puntuales fuertes (25 a 50 mm) : Coahuila, Nuevo León, Tamaulipas, San Luis Potosí, Guerrero, Puebla y Campeche. Intervalos de chubascos (5 a 25 mm) : Chihuahua, Querétaro, Hidalgo, Estado de México, Ciudad de México, Tlaxcala, Morelos, Michoacán, Yucatán y Quintana Roo. Aisladas (0.1 a 5 mm) : Guanajuato. El pronóstico de temperaturas máximas para este 01 de noviembre es el siguiente:
De 35 a 40 °C : Sinaloa, Nayarit, Jalisco, Colima y Michoacán. De 30 a 35 °C : Baja California Sur, Sonora (sur), Coahuila (sur), Nuevo León, Tamaulipas, San Luis Potosí, Durango, Guerrero, Oaxaca, Chiapas, Veracruz, Tabasco, Campeche y Yucatán. El pronóstico de temperaturas mínimas para hoy es :
De -10 a -5 °C con heladas : zonas montañosas de Baja California, Chihuahua y Durango. De -5 a 0 °C con heladas : zonas montañosas de Sonora y Zacatecas.
De 0 a 5 °C : zonas montañosas de Aguascalientes, Jalisco, Michoacán, Estado de México, Hidalgo, Tlaxcala y Puebla. Con información de López-Dóriga Digital

author: js.chinanews.com
title: 江苏发出国土绿化倡议书--中国新闻网|江苏
text:
新闻热线：18013384110 电子邮箱：jsxww110@126.com
江苏发出国土绿化倡议书
2025-03-13 08:10:17
来源：新华日报
3月12日是第47个植树节，省林业局、省绿化委员会办公室向全社会发出国土绿化倡议书，倡导每个适龄公民自觉履行每人每年植树3至5棵法定义务和责任，或者通过造林绿化、抚育管护、自然保护、认种认养、设施修建、捐资捐物、志愿服务等形式履行法定义务。
在拓展绿化空间、科学植树护绿方面，倡议书提出，在严守耕地保护红线的前提下，见缝插绿、身边增绿、宜绿尽绿，不断扩大绿化空间。在乡村，要结合乡村振兴战略实施，加强沿边隙地、低洼地、干旱瘠薄地、盐碱地等非耕地造林绿化，广泛开展村庄绿化美化，让乡村更美丽。在城市，要充分利用闲置土地、屋顶、墙体等空间，建设口袋公园，开展垂直绿化，打造绿色景观，让城市更宜居。要优先使用彩色化、珍贵化、效益化树种造林绿化，大力开展疏林地补植、低效林改造和退化林修复，让绿化发挥更大效益。要遵循科学规律，坚持良种壮苗和乡土树种造林，积极推行以乔木为主、低建养成本绿化模式，走科学、生态、节俭绿化之路。要加强新造林的养护管理，严格遵守森林防火规定，全面加强古树名木保护，共同守护绿色风景线。(记者 吴琼)
编辑：顾名筛

author: Carry Lifte
title: Atlanta Hawks soar past shorthanded Charlotte Hornets with Trae Young's explosive 31 points and prepare for crucial battles against NBA titans including Stephen Curry
text:
Week in Review
The Atlanta Hawks experienced a mix of results this week. While a loss against Brooklyn highlighted some defensive shortcomings, victories over lower-tier opponents rejuvenated the team’s momentum. The overall performance places them at 17th in the league rankings, emphasizing both the challenges they face and the room for improvement ahead.
Thrilling Victory Against Charlotte
On the road, the Hawks delivered a commanding 134-102 win over a shorthanded Charlotte Hornets team. Trae Young emerged as the standout performer, scoring 31 points and distributing eight assists. His efficiency from beyond the arc—making five of nine attempts—secured his place among the elite players who have achieved 30-point games paired with multiple long-range shots. This win marked the most dominant performance of the season and completed a season sweep against their divisional rival.
Crew Contributions and Defensive Play
The success of the game was underscored by strong contributions from multiple players. Dyson Daniels came close to a triple-double by adding 22 points, seven rebounds, and seven assists to his stat line, while Zaccharie Risacher delivered 21 points, including an explosive third quarter that sparked the Hawks’ offensive surge. The team’s collective shooting efficiency of 54% from the field and 49% from three-point range significantly disrupted the opponent’s rhythm. A disciplined defensive effort forced 17 turnovers, leading to 22 fast-break points, and helped maintain an impressive offensive rating throughout the match.
Looking Ahead
The schedule promises further tests as the Hawks prepare to face formidable teams featuring some of the sport’s most talented figures. With a brief three-day rest period ahead of hosting a high-profile matchup at State Farm Arena, the team is focused and determined. Every game brings them closer to playoff contention as they continue to refine their playmaking and tighten their defensive strategies in challenging encounters.

author: GlobePRwire
title: Pse.USDT, How a Leading DePIN Project is Innovating the Solar Industry | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
How a Leading DePIN Project is Innovating the Solar Industry
Pse.USDT Leads the Solar Industry with DePIN, Making Users Key Players in Energy Distribution.
As cryptocurrencies and Web3 increasingly integrate into our daily lives, a pressing question arises: How can these digital advancements be translated into tangible infrastructure for everyday use? The evolution of Web3 beyond virtual spaces and digital assets heralds a new era where these technological innovations will significantly impact our physical world.
Why is the Practical Application of Blockchain Crucial?
The journey of blockchain from a virtual concept to practical applications marks a significant evolution. It is no longer just about cryptocurrencies and online transactions. Now, blockchain is poised to become a fundamental tool for constructing and managing physical infrastructure, making it more efficient, transparent, and decentralized.
This transformative role of blockchain extends especially to areas where technology intersects critically with physical infrastructure. The energy industry is one such field. As we strive to address environmental challenges and shift towards renewable resources, blockchain offers solutions for managing these vital resources.
This is where DePIN (Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Networks) comes into play, particularly in the energy sector. DePIN represents an approach to energy infrastructure that changes how we produce, distribute, and consume energy. In a world increasingly focused on sustainability and efficiency, DePIN provides a way to decentralize energy systems, making them more resilient, responsive, and aligned with Web3 principles.
At the heart of this discussion is the intersection of DePIN and blockchain. These innovations not only redefine the digital realm but also reshape the foundation of our physical infrastructure. By combining blockchain with DePIN, we see energy systems that are not only smart but also community-driven and inherently democratic.
Let us explore the role of DePIN and blockchain in promoting a new era of decentralized energy—an era that brings the promises of Web3 into our daily lives, transforming the way we interact with and benefit from the energy around us.
Exploring the Connection Between DePIN and Blockchain
DePIN represents a new model for building physical infrastructure networks—from mobile solutions and telecommunication services to energy systems. What sets DePIN apart is its focus on community-driven development rather than the traditional corporate-led approach. Through blockchain, these networks use tokens to incentivize communities to collaborate from the ground up in constructing and maintaining these infrastructures.
Blockchain is the perfect complement to the DePIN model. The inherent transparency and immutability of blockchain ensure data security and reliability. In DePIN projects, blockchain acts as a trustless intermediary, providing a secure and transparent way to record transactions, track contributions, and distribute rewards within the network.
Additionally, integrating smart contracts into these systems enhances efficiency. These automatically executing contracts with predefined rules can streamline various processes within DePIN, reducing the need for intermediaries. This automation is particularly impactful in areas like transaction settlements and incentive distributions, where traditional methods often involve complexity and delays.
Moreover, decentralizing control is not just about democratizing infrastructure. It also enhances the network's resilience and adaptability. The decentralization of DePIN spreads decision-making power across a broader network, allowing it to respond more flexibly to changes and challenges. It enables infrastructure to develop in a more inclusive and collaborative manner, recognizing and rewarding the contributions of every participant.
Adopting DePIN marks a leap into the future where infrastructure is designed to be resilient, decentralized, and autonomously aligned with the evolving needs of the community. In this future, the role of blockchain will transcend the digital realm, directly impacting and shaping our physical world.
Pse.USDT's DePIN Concept: A Pioneer in Solar Decentralization
Just as Helium has become a well-known brand for decentralizing communication among smart devices, Pse.USDT is emerging as a pioneer in the solar energy sector. Their implementation of the DePIN (Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Networks) concept is reshaping how solar energy is accessed and utilized.
As a DecEnergy (Decentralized Energy) platform utilizing DePIN, Pse.USDT plays a crucial role. Similar to how Helium establishes decentralized networks for the Internet of Things (IoT), Pse.USDT applies similar principles to solar energy. Their approach involves creating a network where individuals with solar panels can not only consume energy but also become integral parts of a larger decentralized energy system.
By leveraging DePIN, Pse.USDT is making solar energy more widespread and accessible, allowing everyone to benefit. This isn't just about harnessing solar power; it's about transforming every solar panel owner into an active participant in the energy market. This shift from mere consumers to producers and distributors democratizes the energy landscape, aligning perfectly with the spirit and principles of Web3 and decentralization.
Pse.USDT's DePIN model ensures that solar energy production is not centralized but distributed across a network of individual producers. This structure not only optimizes the use of renewable energy but also empowers homeowners and businesses to control their own energy production and consumption.
Transforming Renewable Energy with Blockchain
At the core of Pse.USDT's blockchain is the "Proof of Generation" consensus mechanism. This system prioritizes the production of renewable energy, aligning blockchain operations with net-zero goals. It minimizes the environmental impact of blockchain while supporting the creation of sustainable energy.
High Expectations for Pse.USDT
Pse.USDT has made significant strides in the DecEnergy sector, managing over 1 megawatt of solar power capacity globally. Their partnerships with leading solar companies underscore their growing influence. With more households adopting solar panels, Pse.USDT has enormous growth potential. Their vision includes expanding energy certificates to the electric vehicle sector, further enhancing their green energy solutions.
Pse.USDT exemplifies the real-world application of blockchain technology, providing both direct economic benefits and promoting environmental sustainability. By combining blockchain with solar solutions, they are adopting new technologies to create a more sustainable and empowered future. Contact name: Nikki
Company name: Greyscale

author: Mahipal Singh Chouhan
title: Fearless honey badgers face off against pride of lions in viral video, guess who won
text: Viral A viral video captures two honey badgers fearlessly fighting off a pride of lions in a forest. The honey badger, renowned for its unmatched bravery, has once again demonstrated why it holds the title of the most fearless animal in the world. Despite its modest size, this carnivore's ferocious defensive abilities and aggressive nature have earned it a place in the Guinness Book of Records as the "most fearless animal in the world," capable of taking on much larger predators like lions and hyenas. These two honey badgers decide to take on a group of SEVEN lions.— Nature is Amazing (@AMAZlNGNATURE) [pic.twitter.com/sLfoq2GlGg] [July 18, 2024] A recent viral video showcases this tenacity. Shared on the platform X, the video captures a pair of honey badgers engaging in a fierce battle with a pride of lions in a forest. Recorded by a tourist, the footage reveals the intense showdown between the two groups, neither willing to concede defeat. In a surprising twist, the two small honey badgers ultimately scare the lions away, proving once again that size is no match for sheer bravery and self-defense skills. Since its upload, the video has amassed over 405,000 views and numerous amazed comments. One user remarked, "Honey badger don't care," referencing a popular slogan associated with these indomitable creatures. Another commented, "Size is nothing in front of bravery and self-defense skills." Honey badgers are found throughout most of sub-Saharan Africa, Saudi Arabia, Iran, and western Asia. According to South African Country Life, their bodies are well-equipped to fend off predators, boasting sharp claws, incredibly strong jaws, and thick skin. This anatomical prowess ensures they remain a formidable force in the wild, earning their reputation as the fearless warriors of the animal kingdom.

author: Chorus Nylander
title: Patagonia mining project ramping up activity as it prepares "critical mineral" production | In-Depth | kvoa.com
text:
PATAGONIA, Ariz. (KVOA) - It's the largest private investment ever made in Southern Arizona and is getting closer to being fully operational.
The Hermosa Mine in the Patagonia Mountains, owned by Australian company South32, is starting to hire more and more workers as it prepares to be fully operational in 2027.
The mine will produce two minerals South32 considers critical for U.S. interests, Zinc and Manganese.
Currently those two minerals, used to create batteries, are mostly produced in China.
Hermosa Mine President Pat Reisner said the production has been fast tracked by the federal government and has been getting interest from the Department of Defense due to how important these materials are.
“These resources are critical minerals because we’re dependent on foreign nations for our supply that creates risk for our country, that creates national security risk. It’s the only mine development that will produce two critical minerals," he said.
Before production can happen at full scale there is a lot of testing and construction going on at the site as well as off-site battery testing to make sure the materials are effective for their intended use.
All of these efforts have brought in more than 1,000 construction jobs. South32 is constructing a special facility in nearby Nogales that will allow workers with little to no experience the ability to control mining equipment virtually.
South32 will be providing specialized training courses and employing upwards of 900 Santa Cruz County residents.
“We’ve committed to over 80 percent of our long-term workforce being residents of Santa Cruz County," Reisner said.
In all South32 said there will be 2,381 direct and indirect jobs created in Santa Cruz County and 3,465 direct and indirect jobs created in Arizona as a result of the project.
There will be a labor income of $194 million in the County and $290 million statewide, according to South32.
The company said there will be an economic output of $1.16 billion for the County and $1.49 billion for the state.
South32 also estimates there will be local tax revenues of $26 million for the county and $29 million for the state.
Reisner and his team gave News 4 Tucson's Chief Investigative Reporter Chorus Nylander a tour of the mine Wednesday morning.
There we could see a large mining shaft that Reisner said will go to depths of 3,000 feet. Using automated machinery they will be able to go even further, below 4,000 feet.
Reisner said the mine is much more compact than open pit mines. Giving a comparison he said the Hermosa mine is slightly larger than Disney Land at 750 acres. That is a tiny fraction of the average space of an Arizona open pit mine which he said goes beyond 10,000 acres.
Reisner said they are also trying to be good stewards of the environment and are going to be using 90 percent less water than mines of similar volume.
They are also looking at ways to better protect groundwater levels.
That's a big concern for many Santa Cruz County residents like Robin Lucky who leads the Calabasas Alliance, a local group focused on environmental protection.
“What happens to a place when there’s no groundwater that sounds like a catastrophe to me," Lucky said.
Lucky recently got a tour of the mine herself and was happy to see some of the measures they are taking but still questions what the true impact to the areas water levels will be.
She said recent studies by the Arizona Department of Water Quality show the area has about 25 years of groundwater left. She worries the mine will use up too much of the precious resource that water is.
She is also concerned about air quality and the risk of toxins getting in the air. She said the University of Arizona and Arizona State University, working with Calabasas Alliance, have already started placing air quality sensors across the area.
She says they are using two types of monitors. The first is a PurpleAir that residents can view reporting for themselves here and a higher quality device.
“We think baseline monitoring before extraction starts is incredibly important and we have the support of two major universities.”
After over 35 years in the mining industry, Reisner said he's never been a part of such an environmentally conscious project.
"Without a doubt, there’s nothing even close to it.”

author: M. Alarcón
title: Detenido por la Policía un ladrón de iglesias en Elche
text: Detenido un ladrón de iglesias en Elche que se llevó objetos del culto e instrumentos musicales El sacristán y las cámaras de seguridad del templo han permitido resolver el asalto a la sacristía en un operativo en el que ha participado Policía Local y Nacional Un crucifijo, una esfera dorada, medallas doradas con la imagen de la virgen y una cruz metálica, así como instrumentos musicales y un amplificador, fueron el botín de un ladrón de 50 años en una iglesia de [Elche](https://www.informacion.es/tags/elche/), que la Comisaría se resiste a identificar su ubicación después de haberlos recuperado prácticamente todos y capturado el autor del robo. La [profanación del lugar de culto](https://www.informacion.es/elche/2022/05/23/fuerzan-acceso-iglesias-elche-robar-66439247.html) hace más daño por la sensación de impunidad que genera que por el valor intrínseco de los objetos. El arresto del autor ha sido posible gracias a la colaboración del grupo de Robos de la Policía Nacional y agentes de la Policía Local, se resalta en el comunicado. El arrestado ha ingresado en prisión tras prestar declaración judicial a instancias de la Fiscalía. Se le acusa de un robo con fuerza. Sacristán El robo fue descubierto por el sacristán, que vio merodear a un hombre por delante de la sacristía y al que no conocía de nada, lo cual le infundió sospechas. Se acercó a esa sala, habitualmente cerrada, donde se revisten los sacerdotes y están guardados los ornamentos y otras cosas pertenecientes al culto, para descubrir que la puerta había sido forzada. No solo faltaban objetos religiosos que allí se guardaban sino instrumentos musicales. Mientras tanto, esa persona había desaparecido del templo. Entonces dio aviso a la Policía Local. Parroquia El sacristán comentó a los agentes lo ocurrido y facilitó la descripción de esta persona. Se dio la circunstancia de que, precisamente, minutos antes, habían identificado por las inmediaciones de la parroquia a alguien que casaba con la identificación del responsable de la parroquia. Se realizó un reportaje fotográfico y un informe de lo sucedido y se facilitó la descripción física y ropas por si alguien podía localizarlo, pero en un primer momento, no fue así. En gestiones posteriores, agentes de la [Policía Local](https://www.elche.es/policia-local/) sí identificaron a un hombre que portaba varios objetos religiosos de cuya procedencia no daba razones, por lo que, como medida preventiva, intervinieron los objetos y comunicaron tal hecho al Grupo de Robos de la Comisaría de Policía Nacional en Elche, encargado de la investigación. Ahora bien, el comunicado no explica por qué no se le detuvo. Entre los objetos que le decomisaron también estaba así como dos guitarras, un amplificador y un micrófono. La coordinación y cooperación entre los diferentes cuerpos de seguridad es esencial para ofrecer un servicio de calidad a la ciudadanía, siendo un criterio necesario para garantizar la seguridad pública en todos los ámbitos, explican desde la Comisaría de Elche Propiedad de la iglesia El Grupo de Investigación especializado en Robos, continuó con las pesquisas y, tras analizar las imágenes de las cámaras de seguridad del lugar, se pudo identificar plenamente al autor de los hechos. Además de esto, el propio sacristán de la parroquia reconoció los objetos intervenidos por la Policía Local al investigado como propiedad de la parroquia. Ante todo ello, los agentes adscritos al [Grupo de Robos de la Policía Nacional en Elche](https://www.policia.es/_gl/dependencias_localizador_accesible_provincias.php), iniciaron un dispositivo de búsqueda de esta persona que culminó con su detención y la recuperación de una caja de color rojo que contenía más objetos religiosos tales como; un crucifijo y una esfera metálica dorada, una caja de plástico conteniendo medallas doradas con la imagen de la virgen y una cruz metálica dorada, que resultaron pertenecer también a la parroquia y que fueron entregados al sacristán convenientemente. La nota también asegura que se robaron instrumentos musicales, pero no detalla cuáles y si se han recuperado. Antecedentes El arrestado, de 50 años de edad y que contaba con multitud de antecedentes por delitos similares, fue puesto a disposición del Juzgado de Instrucción de guardia de la localidad de Elche, que decretó su ingreso en prisión. La Comisaría destaca que "la coordinación y cooperación entre los diferentes cuerpos de seguridad es esencial para ofrecer un servicio de calidad a la ciudadanía, siendo un criterio necesario para garantizar la seguridad pública en todos los ámbitos". Por desgracia, los robos en templos e iglesias, donde apenas hay medidas de seguridad [son relativamente habituales](https://www.informacion.es/vega-baja/2023/06/01/detienen-hombre-37-anos-robo-88176379.html) por la, cómo no, buena fe de las propias parroquias. El pasado año, sin ir más lejos, se produjo otro caso en los [cepillos de la Santa Faz](https://www.informacion.es/sucesos/sucesos-en-alicante/2023/01/14/detenido-desvalijar-cepillo-santa-faz-81108828.html). En pedanías y pueblos pequeños, lo son aún más, al punto de que [hay ladrones especializados en estos delitos](https://www.informacion.es/sucesos/sucesos-en-alicante/2023/06/22/cae-grupo-robaba-iglesias-farmacias-89036463.html).
